title: Can taliyah get a second passive?
body:
It's probably one of the worst in the game. Aurelion Has it on his E and he doesn't have to be near walls.
a few champions come to mind with two passives on their passive, so why can't taliyah have two?
She just something to help her kit out or something.

{{champion:157}}  = Double Crit + free Shield

And a ton of others.

- Can buy non-consumable items anywhere while out of combat.
- He and his teammates have access to upgraded items with enhanced stats.
- His basic attacks knock back Brittle enemies.
- Brittle enemies take % max HP magic damage when immobilized by him or one of his allies.

That's literally 3 or 4 passives depending on how you look at it, and NONE of them have drawbacks.

Her passive is pretty amazing as-is.  20-40% movement speed near walls is a lot.  It 

1) Gives you mid priority even if the wave is at your turret.

2) Cuts a lot of time out of roaming to use your wall and coming back to lane.

3) Gets you around the map fast with no wall.

She also has another passive, which is her Worked Ground, which gives her 10% bonus movement speed.  This helps her:

1) Dodge skillshots and escape ganks without boots

2) Chase, kite, juke, and match jukes when firing her Q.

3) Interact with Rylai’s to make her a kiting machine.

But you can't look at them without the context. Darius is a juggernaut who has to get close and personal to deal with you and proceed destroying your team, that's the reason for his passive, to crush fights where you let him live/stack freely. Taliyah is a control/waveclear mage who likes to roam, and as such she benefits from this passive (and with waterwalking and celerity it gets better I guess) because she likes to clear and roam, and this helps her coming back to lane too. She gets MS on Worked Ground as well, helping her escape from ganks and avoiding skillshot.

Personally, I would want more interaction with her E and W rather than more passives. They feel so barebones and underwhelming as zoning tools against anyone with the slightest bit of MR and mobility. Maybe her W can act like {{champion:67}}'s E. Knocking someone into a wall will briefly stun them. For her E minefield, maybe the exploding rocks can act like {{champion:78}}'s W. Enemies who trigger more than 2 rocks will be slightly knocked.

First of all, Taliyah is fine. Currently, one of the most balanced champions, she doesn't need anything else.
Secondly, there are just few champions with 2 passives. Most champions have just 1, so I don't see why she should have two as well.
Third, just because some champions has double passives, doesn't mean a champion with one is weaker or unfairly treated. They have power somewhere else in their kit.
because her passive is kinda garbage

How is it garbage? Getting a lot of MS while near terrain is garbage? Like, you get back to lane much quicker so you have priority, your roaming is much better. You need to get your head out of the flat stat buff and realize how important other utility abilities are.
Well that’s your opinion, a tiny move speed bonus for losing a lot of her dmg is not worth, the worked ground is not that great

Which is also your opinion. The thing about mine, though, is that it's also shared by a lot of high elo players, claiming that any bonus MS you can have in your champion is extremely important. Look at how many players pick Celerity as a secondary rune for a tiny 3% MS increase. It's so important.
